intro: Sauropus trachyspermus, commonly known as wild betel, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often followed by orange or red capsules containing seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is cultivated in many parts of the world.
